awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Virtual and Augmented Reality Enabled Personalized Manufacturing Training
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research SBIR Phase II project will be achieved through investigating approaches to leverage extended reality (XR) for immersive, interactive and intelligent training in manufacturing, healthcare and higher education, to accelerate learning, increase engagement, and foster more effective use of expensive equipment. In 2017, the global training market was estimated to be $388 B, while the US market was estimated to be $166 B. Training and design use cases frequently rank among the top 5 XR use cases in industry reports, and the enterprise VR training market alone is forecasted to grow at 140% year over year for the next five years to reach $6.3 B per year. XR technologies hold significant potential by providing users with a sense of presence and immersion heretofore not possible due to cost, safety, security, physical, geographical or other limitations. This project will pursue this growing market opportunity with content expected to bring together classrooms, labs, factories, hospitals and field service environments, broadly advancing learning and engagement in both schools and workplaces.

The intellectual merit of this SBIR Phase II project lies in the development of high- fidelity modular and reusable virtual object and assembly models, customized models for scenarios, tasks, instructions and user proficiency, application of natural language processing techniques to enable conversational interactions in immersive multiplayer environments and the use of computer vision techniques to support effective reuse of content across both virtual and augmented reality settings. Specialized modules will be developed for each of the above functionalities and then integrated to develop an innovative, easy-to-use product that will make it easy for non-programmers to author and publish XR content for training, design, service and other use cases, as well as collect data to evaluate the content and experiences. Pilot testing will be conducted with users in the higher education industry to rigorously evaluate and iteratively refine the technologies and the final product. By judiciously combining XR, virtual objects, and simulations with voice, vision and collaboration, this project aims to build an innovative product that may enable anyone to build engaging knowledge-rich content.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
This NSF SBIR project has enabled Siminsights to develop and launch an innovative no-code platform for authoring, publishing and evaluating immersive, intelligent and interactive personalized training content for manufacturing, healthcare, education and other sectors. SimInsights has launched HyperSkill as a low cost software as a service platform and trained hundreds of people from students to professional content creators on immersive, generative AI-powered content creation through dozens of webinars and workshops and hundreds of youtube videos. This group of author users has created thousands of simulations that are available to tens of thousands of learners from hundreds of organizations worldwide. Learner users include middle school students exploring different careers as well as professional clinicians learning to take care of patients and factory workers receiving training of equipment and procedures. Training domains include hard skills such as nursing, patient diagnostics, electric vehicle repair, assembly, machining, product design and robotics as well as soft skills such as sales training, customer service and interview practice. HyperSkill has also been recognized as a research tool to investigate new learning interventions and rapidly gather efficacy data. Author users are moving beyond creating individual simulations to building collections of simulations for apprenticeship and credentialing programs. The breadth and depth of ways in which HyperSkill has been applied to address training and education needs demonstrates its potential as a general purpose platform that can reduce the cost of effective training in multiple industries. As a networked content platform, HyperSkill is also promoting content reuse across industrial and educational training in an efficient and effective way, further amplifying impact.

 

As a general purpose platform, HyperSkill delivers a number of key features including generative-AI integration for accelerated content creation, AI-powered tutors for improving learning outcomes, no code authoring for faster content development by non-programmer users, reusable asset repository with over 2000 reusable 3D assets with interactions and animations, cross platform content delivery across VR, MR, Web, Mobile and desktops and multiplayer for group based learning. HyperSkill also includes integrations with third party systems including learning management systems, payment processing, authentication services, 3D CAD data import, privacy & security certifications, data collection, analytics and dashboards. HyperSkill simulations can also be distributed through an immersive learning marketplace named Skillful.  HyperSkill platform is available at a competitive price to education and enterprise customers. Specifically for the K12 market, HyperSkill includes a content library of over 300 career exploration simulations covering over 20 career pathways. K12 schools, districts and non-profits are adopting HyperSkill at a healthy pace. With HyperSkill, K12 schools receive not only the content library, but also a creation platform that enables students and teachers to create their own content.

 

SimInsights has created a community of creators and learners who can share knowledge and insights via a forum as well as list their content for sale in an immersive learning content marketplace (Skillful). The marketplace is expected to accelerate content creation and amplify the adoption of immersive learning. Looking ahead, SimInsights is excited to continue work on maturing the HyperSkill platform with innovative technologies such as generative AI and new VR/AR devices, experiment with innovative immersive learning designs, expand the content library to reach 1000 simulations covering all K12 topics, and enrich the community to serve a wider range of learners in new domains including semiconductors, nuclear energy and defense.

 


Last Modified: 02/04/2025
Modified by: Rajesh K Jha
